```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(flexdashboard)
library(tidyverse)
library(p8105.datasets)
library(plotly)
```

```{r}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
	echo = TRUE,
	warning = FALSE,
	fig.width = 8, 
  fig.height = 6,
  out.width = "90%"
)

options(
  ggplot2.continuous.colour = "viridis",
  ggplot2.continuous.fill = "viridis"
)

scale_colour_discrete = scale_colour_viridis_d
scale_fill_discrete = scale_fill_viridis_d

theme_set(theme_minimal() + theme(legend.position = "bottom"))
```

```{r}
data("instacart")

set.seed(123)

instacart_data <-
  instacart %>% 
  sample_n(5000)
```


Column {data-width=650}
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

### Chart A

```{r}
instacart %>% 
  count(order_hour_of_day) %>% 
  plot_ly(x = ~order_hour_of_day, y = ~n, type = "bar")
```

Column {data-width=350}
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

### Chart B

```{r}
boxplot_instacart <- instacart_data %>% 
  group_by(order_hour_of_day, department) %>% 
  count(department) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = department, y = order_hour_of_day, color = department)) + 
  geom_boxplot() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1))

ggplotly(boxplot_instacart)
```

### Chart C

```{r}
instacart_data %>% 
  filter(
    department == "snacks"
  ) %>%
  count(aisle) %>% 
  mutate(
    aisle = fct_reorder(aisle, n)
  ) %>% 
  mutate(
    aisle = as.factor(aisle)
  ) %>% 
  plot_ly(x = ~aisle, y = ~n, color = ~aisle, type = "bar")
```
